page.title: 16Shopping 4
page.content: If a footpath was built it would make the road dangerously narrow near the bend. Many large lorries use this road. The Shopping Centre is small because the village is small. Many families shop outside the village at Supermarkets such as Tates in Immingham, Fine Fare in Barton or Asdas in Grimsby. Prices are lower in those shops and there is a wider range of goods for sale. Families without their own car usually use the village shops because travel is expensive and difficult with few buses. Other families use the village shops when they only want a few items or haven't the time for a 'big shop'. A survey carried out in the school showed that most people used the village shops to buy newspapers, bread and sweets.
